intro: Ophthalmophyllum jacobsenianum, commonly known as the Jacobson's eyeplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its unique appearance and adaptation to harsh conditions make it a notable species in its native habitat.
